info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 14 at 7:40PM CDT until further notice by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN...SOUTHEASTERN CRAWFORD AND NORTHEASTERN SEBASTIAN COUNTIES... At 740 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lavaca, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Charleston... Alma... Barling... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Bloomer... Kibler... Central City... Concord... Shibley... Vesta... Furry... Ursula... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 7 and 25. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
